{"step_by_step_thinking": "The woman is Rh-negative and the father is Rh-positive, which means there is a risk of Rh incompatibility between the mother and fetus. Rh incompatibility can lead to hemolytic disease of the newborn (HDN) if the mother becomes sensitized to the Rh antigen. To prevent sensitization, the most appropriate administration at this time is Anti-D IgG, which is given to Rh-negative mothers to prevent the formation of anti-D antibodies. Anti-A IgG, Anti-B IgG, and Anti-D IgM are not indicated in this situation.", "answer_choice": "B. Anti-D IgG"}
